page.title: 14ORNITHOLOGY (PART ONE)
page.content: Mr Fleming one of the parents took six pupils on a field trip. Armed with binoculars,wellingtons and a handbook we set off. We learned not to look into the sun with binoculars,to stay away from swans on nests and keep quiet,don't trespass on I.C.I. property and beware of swampy ground.As the tide was in we didn't see wading birds.Swallows and rooks were most common and had nested in old air raid shelters. {Birds spotted;} Swallow,Chaffinch,Oyster Catchers* Yellowhammer*,Heron,Curlew*,Swan*, Redshank*,Rooks,Shellduck*,Cormorant, Blackheaded Gull*.{ {The bird sanctuary}is much busier in the winter months as birds from Arctic Circle migrate here.(*These birds nest here).
